column4: hello, i have a problem getting my monitor to display higher than 1024 x 768.
have a look at your xorg.conf file.
in your xorg.conf file, look for default depth
hang on one.....
on my system it is in /etc/X11/xorg.conf
you may need to change the default depth to say 16 or 24, depending on you monior, BUT !
try using default depth 16 and see what happenns, BUT !
be sure to make a backup of the xorg.conf FIRST.
then.....
close ALL open windows and press control/alt backspace to restart X
I also found that another display setting is a bit better on the eyes.
I use 1152x864 to be flicker free and less straing on the eyes.
that is at least on my system.
well can you post some where I can see you xorg.conf file ?
hang on a sec....
can you send your xorg.conf to pastebin please ?
okay, let me go look.
looks good. Did you try default depth of 16 ?
when I changed my default to 24, it opened up to1820x1024 and back
I was stuck in 1024x768 for a bit until I researched it out/
I am trying to remember where the setting for smooth scrolling is to turn it off......
does this happen in all screens or just in certain screens/programs ?
